title: Frontend fixes: social/phone links, logo asset, password-only admin gate, admin password wiring, and name-based recipient search

requirements.summary: Replace all placeholder Facebook/WhatsApp share links with the exact user-provided destinations across the existing UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking any Facebook icon/button in the app opens https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61575264476230 in a new tab/window.
Clicking any WhatsApp icon/button in the app opens a WhatsApp chat link for 9804968758 in a new tab/window.
No remaining anchors in the UI still point to the placeholder https://facebook.com or https://wa.me.

file_operations.description: Update footer social share anchors to use the provided Facebook profile URL and a working WhatsApp wa.me link for 9804968758 (open in new tab, keep rel attributes). Also scan this file for any remaining placeholder https://facebook.com or https://wa.me and replace them.

Update both the Share Card and Footer social anchors to use the provided Facebook profile URL and a working WhatsApp wa.me link for 9804968758. Ensure there are no remaining placeholder https://facebook.com or https://wa.me values in this layout.

requirements.summary: Render all displayed phone numbers as tappable tel: links without changing the current layout/styling.
acceptanceCriteria: On mobile, tapping the displayed phone number opens the dialer with the number prefilled.
Phone numbers are rendered as accessible links (e.g., <a href="tel:...">) without breaking the current layout/styling.

file_operations.description: Convert the Landing page contact strip phone numbers (9804968758, 9814965177) and the Landing footer phone number display to accessible tel: links (e.g., tel:9804968758), preserving existing typography/colors and spacing.
Convert the Dashboard header contact strip and Dashboard footer phone number display(s) to accessible tel: links for each displayed number, preserving styling and layout.

requirements.summary: Ensure the logo file exists as a static asset and that existing /assets/logo-job.jpg references render correctly across Landing, Dashboard, and Admin UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The logo renders (not broken/missing) on the Landing page hero section.
The logo renders on the Dashboard header and footer.
The logo renders on the Admin header.
The deployed build contains the logo at /assets/logo-job.jpg and the browser network panel shows it loading successfully (HTTP 200).

file_operations.description: Add/replace the deployed static logo asset at this exact path so existing references resolve at runtime. Use the user-provided logo from the workspace assets.
Verify all existing usages remain unchanged and continue to reference the static asset path, so the new logo loads in hero and footer.
Verify all existing usages remain unchanged and continue to reference the static asset path, so the new logo loads in header and footer.
Verify the Admin header continues using so it loads from the replaced static asset, while implementing the password gate changes from REQ-4.

requirements.summary: Lock the entire /admin area behind a password-only gate using session storage, removing any Internet Identity requirement for viewing admin routes once unlocked.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting /admin without having entered the password shows only a password prompt and does not show vacancies/posts admin content.
Entering "@rewan10" unlocks the admin panel and allows navigation between admin tabs.
Entering a wrong password does not unlock the admin panel and shows an error message in English.
Refreshing the page after unlocking keeps access for the current session (until the session storage is cleared or the browser session ends).

file_operations.description: Create a small session-storage-backed utility hook for admin password gating: read/write/clear the current session admin password, and expose an "isUnlocked" boolean for the current session. Keep all user-facing text out of this hook (logic only).

Add a password prompt component for /admin routes. It should accept the password, validate it client-side against the exact string "@rewan10", store it via the session-storage hook on success, and show a clear English error message on failure. Keep UI minimal and consistent with existing styling (use existing shadcn/ui inputs/buttons where appropriate—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

Replace the current Internet Identity + role-based access guard with the new password gate. When not unlocked, render only the AdminPasswordGate (no admin content). When unlocked, render the existing admin header/nav/content. Remove redirects that force Internet Identity for /admin access. Add a "Lock Admin" / "Sign out of Admin" action that clears the session password and returns to the password prompt state. Keep all user-facing text in English.

Update the existing "Admin Login" action so it no longer depends on Internet Identity for reaching /admin; it should navigate to /admin (which will show the password prompt when locked). Ensure any changed labels remain English.

requirements.summary: Update the admin frontend to pass the session-stored admin password into password-authorized backend calls, and gracefully recover to the password prompt on invalid/expired password.
acceptanceCriteria: Creating/updating/deleting vacancies works from the admin UI after entering the password.
Creating/updating/deleting posts works from the admin UI after entering the password.
If the session password is cleared/invalid, admin actions fail gracefully and the UI prompts again for the password.

file_operations.description: Update all admin React Query mutation functions (create/update/delete vacancies and posts) to include the admin password argument sourced from the session-storage admin password hook. If no password is available, fail with a clear English error. If a backend authorization failure occurs, clear the stored session password so the AdminLayout returns to the password prompt state.

Ensure admin vacancy create/update/delete actions surface clear English error feedback when password is missing/invalid (e.g., show an alert or inline message) and that the UI returns to the password prompt by relying on the cleared session password state.

Ensure admin post create/update/delete actions surface clear English error feedback when password is missing/invalid (e.g., show an alert or inline message) and that the UI returns to the password prompt by relying on the cleared session password state.

requirements.summary: Replace the admin-only receiver Principal input in the message compose form with a name-based person search, while keeping non-admin compose behavior unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: As an admin, the compose form no longer asks for a principal ID directly.
As an admin, typing into the person search filters a list by first/last name and allows selecting a recipient.
After selecting a person by name and sending, the message is sent to the correct principal.
As a non-admin user, the compose form behavior remains unchanged (no recipient selection required).

file_operations.description: Create a React Query hook that calls the backend capability for admin-only user search (authorizedUserSearch) with the session-stored admin password and an optional search term, returning a list of profiles (principal + first/last name). If the password is missing/invalid, fail with a clear English error and clear the stored password so /admin UI returns to the password prompt state.

Update the admin compose UI: remove the freeform "Receiver Principal" input and replace it with a name-based search input + selectable results list powered by the authorized user search hook. Show the selected person's full name (optionally also a shortened principal). On send, use the selected person's principal as receiver. Preserve non-admin compose flow (no recipient selection required) and keep all user-facing text in English (use existing shadcn/ui components where appropriate—verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

Adjust the send message flow as needed so non-admin users can still send messages without manual recipient entry, while admin sends use the selected recipient principal. Keep behavior for inbox/sent fetching unchanged.
